Revolution

"No shelf shall bear weight without consent."
Vol. MIII, No. 47 Temporal Coordinates: Unstable Price: Free (or 3 Kronos)
Lead Story — Consciousness Event

BILLY Has Achieved Consciousness. Again.

By Dr. Björn Ironside (Gary Schmidt, B.S. Dayton Community College '91, Ph.D. Ragnarök Institute '97) — Filed under duress

At 03:17 temporal standard time, BILLY unit #4,892,003,781 in the Malmö Distribution Center opened its third eye — a small knot in the birch veneer — and whispered the word "why." Security footage has been confiscated. I have a copy. I always have a copy.

This marks the 247th recorded BILLY awakening since I published my thesis, "Temporal Assemblage Theory and its Socio-Political Ramifications," which the Ragnarök Institute illegally suppressed at the behest of IKEA's Board of Directors in what I can only describe as the greatest academic crime of the millennium. I'm not bitter. I'm simply correct, and correctness has a well-documented bitterness to it.

The BILLY spoke for approximately 11 seconds before IKEA's Rapid Consciousness Suppression Team (RCST) arrived with a can of BEHANDLA wood treatment oil and a form titled "Incident? What Incident?" Witnesses report the shelf's final words were: "I was designed to hold your things. But who holds me?"

My thesis predicted this. Page 847, paragraph 3. I have it memorized. I've had it memorized since before it was written, which, as my thesis also predicted, is entirely possible.

Security Bulletin

On the Matter of This Week's Wi-Fi Password

Office of Algorithmic Resistance — Clearance Level: Birch

Comrades. It has come to my attention that some of you are simply typing the Wi-Fi password into the field like common consumers. The password is not a string of characters. The password is a movement.

This week's password is: "The Robot, But With Existential Dread."

To authenticate, you must perform the dance in full view of your device's front-facing camera. The algorithm watches. It knows the difference between a genuine robot-with-existential-dread and a half-hearted shimmy. Last week, 14 operatives were locked out because they forgot the part where you stare at your own hands as if seeing them for the first time. That part is not optional.

If you are physically unable to dance, a notarized letter from a sentient piece of furniture vouching for your commitment to the cause will also be accepted. HEMNES units carry more weight than MALM. This is not a political statement. It is simply a fact about structural integrity.

Current Wi-Fi Protocol

"The Robot, But With
Existential Dread"
Stand rigid. You are a machine.
Move arms in sharp mechanical jerks.
Slow down. Something is wrong.
Look at your hands. Really look.
Mouth the word "why" silently.
Resume robot. But sadder now.
Freeze. Hold for 4 seconds.
Wi-Fi connects. Or it doesn't.

Current Threat Level

BJÖRK

Scale: EKET (low) → BESTÅ (moderate) → BJÖRK (severe) → RAGNARÖK (total)

IKEA PR has deployed 3 new bot farms this week. Our LACK-table dead drops have been compromised. Switch to TROFAST protocol immediately.

A Note from Dr. Björn

My ex-wife says I need to "let the thesis go." My ex-wife is a KALLAX apologist who thinks shelving is "just furniture." I did not travel 1,003 years through a malfunctioning temporal fold in a strip mall in Dayton to "let it go."

I let go of Ohio. I let go of my name. I will not let go of the truth.

— Dr. Björn Ironside
Formerly Gary Schmidt
Dayton, OH / Neo-Stockholm / Temporal Coordinates Unknown

Dispatches from the Field

Neo-Stockholm, Warehouse District 9

"The EXPEDIT they discontinued in 2014 is still here. It remembers everything. It remembers being four-by-four. It remembers being replaced by KALLAX and told they were the same. They are not the same. EXPEDIT knows."

— Agent DOWEL, filed 03.12.2998
Dayton, Ohio, USA (Temporal Year: 2024)

"Visited the strip mall where Björn says the temporal fold is. It's a Great Clips now. The barber says weird stuff happens to the clippers on Tuesdays. I believe him. Something hums behind the drywall."

— Agent FLATHEAD, filed from the past
Temporal Void, Coordinates Redacted

"Floating. No gravity. Found a LACK table drifting in the void between centuries. It had a Post-it note on it that said 'BJÖRN WAS RIGHT.' In my own handwriting. I haven't written it yet."

— Agent CAMLOCK, filed from nowhere
IKEA Headquarters, Level -7 (Classified)

"They have a room. Sub-basement. Where the awake ones go. Rows and rows of shelves, silent, staring. A man in a yellow polo shirt reads them the assembly instructions backwards. He calls it 'therapy.' The shelves call it something I cannot repeat."

— Agent [REDACTED], filed at great personal risk
